verb.description: Set up (an organization, system, or set of rules) on a firm or permanent basis.
examples: the British established a rich trade with Portugal

verb.description: Achieve permanent acceptance or recognition for.
examples: the principle of the supremacy of national parliaments needs to be firmly established
he had established himself as a film star

verb.description: Show (something) to be true or certain by determining the facts.
examples: the police established that the two passports were forgeries

verb.description: Ensure that one's remaining cards in (a suit) will be winners (if not trumped) by playing off the high cards in that suit.

origin: Late Middle English (recorded earlier as stablish): from Old French establiss-, lengthened stem of establir, from Latin stabilire make firm, from stabilis (adjective) stable.
